meanings.definition: The act of imposing Nazi ideology or characteristics on a society.
meanings.sent1: The nazification of the town led to strict censorship and propaganda.
meanings.sent2: The nazification of the country's education system was a dark chapter in history.
meanings.sent3: The party threw a nazification-themed costume party, complete with armbands and propaganda posters.
meanings.sent4: The rapid nazification of the region sent chills down the spines of the residents.
meanings.sent5: The gradual nazification of the society was like watching a black-and-white movie turn to color.

meanings.definition: The process of transforming a society into one that resembles Nazi Germany.
meanings.sent1: The nazification of the city was evident in the architecture and symbols displayed.
meanings.sent2: After the war, the country underwent a period of nazification before returning to democracy.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit about a nazification makeover show had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The artist used surreal imagery to depict the nazification of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The novel vividly described the nazification of the town, painting a grim picture of oppression.
